channel.title: Basic GUIs
channel.description:
Hey I got bored and just made some basic GUIs, You guys can edit them and what ever... you want to do.
They all come with a "Run Code.bat", "Compile.bat", Java File, and Class File. You guys can edit them... no credits to me. Enjoy them, I hope it helps you learn how to make them.
SimpleGUI: [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/51897874/Coding.rar.html]DOWNLOAD[/url]
[ul][li]Buttons - Saying which you clicked[/li][/ul]
SimpleGUI2: [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/53125182/SimpleGUI_-_2.rar.html]DOWNLOAD[/url]
[ul][li]Text Areas added (Editable/Non-editable)[/li] [li]Menubar Added[/li][/ul]
SimpleGUI3: [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/53126403/SimpleGUI_-_3.rar.html]DOWNLOAD[/url]
[ul][li]More Added to Menu[/li][/ul]
[hr] NOTE: If you don't trust me... then don't download them. Thought I would help you guys, so I am not going to beg you to download them.
I hope I helped
[b]- Bryanc[/b]

item.title: Basic GUIs
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Wow, thanks for brining back a post from 2 months ago. These are bad yes… but it helped me learn a little bit. I do not even care about these because I still stink at coding and really, I have got a little better but I don’t feel like taking a screenshot of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic GUIs
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:25, topic:140045”][quote author=bakatool link=topic=192187.msg1897812#msg1897812 date=1195987803]
TBH no one should know how to code GUI’s everyone should start of with console applications

if they want GUI They could just download a good IDE which automates making any GUI code by dragging in controls like visual basic… anyone who learns how to program a GUI is really a moron lol since it involves no programming at all just designing.
[/quote]

YAH, I just figured out what you mean by that![/quote]
You both fail.
GUI programming has the potential to be incredibly complex, far more than just ‘mindless designing.’

Read full topic

item.title: Basic GUIs
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

To make a nice GUI, you usually have to put quite alot of effort into it. Considering if you want to customize your components, and add these to whatever place you wish. Another thing would be if you wish to make a nice framework.

Some of these GUI-programs (including IDE’s etc) doesn’t even remove the code for the components if you remove them from the program. In this case you have to remove them manually. And not only that, it might also look bad in comparison with your other code, if their naming conventions, style etc doesn’t match.

Read full topic
